text:
Hello and welcome to Cupcake Addiction's Mario
Mushroom Cupcake Tutorial where I'll be showing

you how to make this gorgeous and super super
easy Super Mario Mushroom cupcakes.

Tools and equipment that we will be using
today:
I've got my little cupcake wrapper printable.

I will leave a link for that in the description
box below.

And I have made that for you guys to make
this just a little bit better as it would
otherwise be.
I've got little bit of wax paper.

Now I've lined my cupcake liner with a little
bit of wax paper.

I just cut around both together and I sticky
taped the wax paper from both ends.

The reason that I've done this is because
we want to have frosting to come right down
to the edges of that cupcake wrapper.
And frosting has got oils and butters in it.

And that will actually set start seeping into
your cupcake wrapper and it will mess things
up.

So the lining that with wax paper is just
going to mean we keep a nice, really neat
finish to the bottom of our Mario mushroom.
I've got my cupcake here to ice.

I've got a little bit of our perfectly pipeable
buttercream frosting.
Now these guys are usually red and green.

I've got a couple of red ones there so I thought
I'll do green for this tutorial.

And I'll leave a recipe link to that frosting
in the description box below if you're looking
for a great frosting recipe.
A little bit of sticky tape.

I've got 4 white candy melts or white chocolate
melts.
And just a knife.

I will also mention today that I'm displaying
these in a little ice cream cone.

Now, if you're in the US, I know that [Ralphs's]
actually sells colored ice cream cone so you
can get pre-colored green ones.

We use to have them here in Australia but
I couldn't find them for this tutorial.

So I've actually taken just regular ice cream
cones.

And I've dipped them in green candy melts
to give them that lovely green effect.

With these ones, if you're going to use them
to display your little Mario mushrooms -- they

do look fantastic but they'll be quite tough
heavy so I've filled mine up with just some

candies, some M&Ms or something like that
just to give that base a little bit more weight

so that when you do put your cupcake on top,
the whole thing doesn't topple over because
it's a bit top heavy.

So the first thing that we want to do is we
want to wrap our cupcake wrapper.

So these are a bit of a one-size-fit-all job
and you'll notice the smaller your cupcake,

you'll have a little more overhang, the larger
your cupcake, you'll have a little bit less
overhang.

So I like to bring that cupcake wrapper right
up to the top of the cupcake.

So the cupcake's sitting nice and flash with
the top there.
And I'm pretty happy with that positioning.
Pop the cupcake out.

Get the 2 pieces roughly where you've positioned
them on the cupcake, and a little bit of sticky
tape or [ends] simply tape the two together.

If you love this tutorial, make sure that
you head on over to our channel My Cupcake
Addiction.

We've got lots of great tutorials and we will
shortly also be uploading this really cool
little Goomba Mario cupcake.

If you want to catch him, make sure that you
subscribe so that you don't miss him.

Now, you've got your little cupcake wrapper
there, ready to go.
Just give it a check.
Make sure that you're happy with that fit.
Looks good to me.
And we want to take the back of our knife.

So I'm just going to use this straight back
edge, not the rounded front edge.

And I'm going to just scoop on some of that
green frosting.

Now for these mushrooms, you do want a fair
bit of frosting, especially on the initial
scoop.
You'll scrape a little bit of this off.

But you want to make that mushroomy top quite
pronounced and quite nice and high and round.

So you'll see there I'm scraping it in downwards
motion, trying not to get too much of that
around the edges of the cupcake wrapper.

It doesn't really matter because we're going
to be putting this nice, decorative wrapper

on any way but just getting into the habit
of not too much of a mess of the outside of
your wrappers is always good.

Now I'm just using my knife, I'm going back
and forward so I've got a nice, even distribution.
Lovely.

And wiping that knife off, I'm going to go
around the sides of the cupcake.

And this is just smoothing so you could do
[instead] fondant finish but I want this to
be really really easy for everyone at home.

And I think they are really really effective
without too many fancy tools or equipment

or utensils or anything like that and not
too expensive.

Alright, so you can see there I've smoothed
that off nicely.

And then you want to drop it into your patty
pan or into your cupcake wrapper.
So I just literally drop it.

Now, if it drops a little bit unevenly, just
use your fingers underneath there and you
can just reposition it.

Now I'm looking at that and it's actually
[got] a little bit too far into that patty

pan so the cupcake wrapper there, it's a tiny
bit big.
I'm going to use my fingers underneath.

I'm going to pop that out and I'm just going
to make that cupcake wrapper a little bit
smaller.
This is something to consider.

You really don't want it being inside the
cupcake wrapper.

You want it to be flashed with the top of
the cupcake wrapper.

So I'm just going to peel open that sticky
tape.

Make it a little smaller by half a centimeter
or so.
A little bit of new sticky tape.
Disasters while filming.
Re- sticky tape that together.
And we'll drop that in again.
Perfect.
So you can see the difference there.

When you look at it, you're actually right
flashed up against the sides of your cupcake
wrapper so the mushroom head is poking out.

So now take your candy melts and you want
the round side to be facing into the frosting
and the flat side facing out.

And I just pop 4 around the outsides of those
cakes, the outsides of that frosting -- nice
and even.

Push them in so that they're nice, even and
flashed against that frosting so they're not
sticking out or anything.

And there you've got your completed little
Mario Mushroom cupcake.

You can take, if you've got one, your little
colored ice cream cone.
You can stick that all together.

And you end up with this really great little
Mario scene.

I hope you've enjoyed this tutorial as much
as I've enjoyed making it for you.

Do make sure that you check out those Goomba
cupcakes, the perfect accompaniment to these
Mario mushrooms.
And as always, thanks very much for watching.
